page.title: 03ECOLOGY ALDWICK DUCK POND
page.content: Aldwick Duck Pond is a designated conservation area,landscaped to preserve the rural environment within the closely built_up urban area. Original aged trees remain:walnut, sweet_chestnut,copper beech,yew,holm oak,sycamore,horse_chestnut.A drainage ditch feeds the pond which is up to three metres in depth.Water birds include coots,mallards,moorhens and visiting species.The pond has been used as a basis for ecological and scientific study:specifically small under_water creatures and surface plants and insects.
